January 5, 195 2
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
WUOA, University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
I cannot tell you how delighted I was to see your note of
December 26th, especially in view of the fact that I knew you
had to do your own typing,
/
I have recently written two or three rather strong letters
and yours is the first reaction I have received, outside of a
notCfrom Waldo who says, "Quit picking on Frank”. I agree with
everything you say. Jim has voiced objection to an expenditure
of Kellogg funds to call together either the Board or the
Executive Committee. I expect to go to Chicago this weekend in
Connection with a meeting of the Committee of Five, and I am
hopeful that a meeting of the Executive Committee at least can
be arranged for within the next week or so.
I am afraid that I differ with you in your nice comment
about both Dick and Jim, to the effect that they are doing a
super job. I have been compelled to admit to myself that they
are doing a very mediocre sort of job, and I am not encouraged.
It is good to hear from you again. I had a general feeling
that you had been rather cool during the last two months, but
your letter certainly was the best New Year’s present I have
received thus far.
With all best wishes.
Cordially yours,
